docs.snippet: An Oregon church lends a hand at an urban public school, fulfilling needs all around while avoiding the tripwire of church-state separation....
docs.lead_paragraph: An Oregon church lends a hand at an urban public school, fulfilling needs all around while avoiding the tripwire of church-state separation.
docs.abstract: Samuel G Freedman On Religion column notes program that enlists evangelical volunteers to help out public schools in Portland, Ore, has drawn interest from states across the country; program fulfills needs of school districts with slashed budgets as well as young evangelicals drawn to cause of social justice, while avoiding tripwire of church-state separation.

headline.main: Help From Evangelicals (Without Evangelizing) Meets the Needs of an Oregon Public School
headline.print_headline: Help From Evangelicals (Without Evangelizing) Meets the Needs of an Oregon Public School
